* Enums for each command type. INDEXCOMMANDs are "done" and "delete"
* as they refer to tasks by their index. ADDCOMMANDs are "todo", "deadline" and
* "event" as they add new tasks to the tasklist
* class for representing all exceptions pertaining to Duke
* class to represent exceptions relating to done and delete
* commands, ie. commands which use index to refer to tasks
* class for exceptions relating to todo, deadline, event commands,
* ie. exceptions that occur during creation of tasks.
* Class providing static parse method for parsing user input
* parse takes in user input and returns the corresponding Command enum
* @param input String[] of the user input split once by " "
* @return Command enum corresponding to the input provided
* Class responsible for reading and writing to file for persistent storage
* @param dirPath Path object to the directory containing the file
* @param filePath Path object to the file storing the task
* Reads tasks from file, converts them to Task objects,
* and returns it as an ArrayList<Task>
* @return ArryaList of Task objects generated from file
* Writes tasks from an ArrayList<Task> to file for persistent storage
* @param tasks ArrayList of tasks to store
* class for deadlines, a type of task, with an added deadline field
* Constructor for task that does not specify whether task is done
* Sets done to false by default
* Constructor for task that specifies whether task is done
* Used when tasks are loaded from storage
* @param done whether task is done or not
public Deadline(String title, Boolean done, String deadline) {
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline for displaying
* @return string representation of the Deadline for displaying
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline for saving
* @return string representation of the Deadline for saving
* class to represent events, a type of task with a eventDate field
* Constructor for event that does not specify whether task is done
* Sets done to false by default
* @param eventDate date and time of event
* Constructor for event that specifies whether task is done
* Used when loading task from storage
* @param eventDate date and time of event
public Event(String title, Boolean done, String eventDate) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event for displaying
* @return string representation of the Event for displaying
* Returns a string representation of the Event for saving
* @return string representation of the Event for saving
/** function to mark this task as done */
* Returns string representation of the task for displaying
* @return string representation of the task for displaying
* Returns a string representation of the task for saving
* @return string representation of the task for saving
* Class that represents the list of tasks
* Method for adding task to list given user input, returns the added task if successful
* @param taskArray String[] of user input split once by " "
* @return Task that was added if successful
public Task addTask(String[] taskArray) throws DukeTaskDetailsException {
throw new DukeTaskDetailsException("Please provide task details");
throw new DukeTaskDetailsException("Please provide both task title and deadline, separated by \"/by\"");
throw new DukeTaskDetailsException("Please provide both event title and date, separated by \"/at\"");
* Method for index commands such as "done" and "delete". Returns task if command
* was succesful, or throw DukeIndexInputException otherwise
* @param taskArray String[] of user input split once by " "
* @return Task that was operated on if successful
public Task indexCommand(String[] taskArray) throws DukeIndexInputException {
throw new DukeIndexInputException("Please enter index of the task");
throw new DukeIndexInputException("Please enter index of the task");
throw new DukeIndexInputException("Sorry! Unable to find task number " + taskArray[1]);
* class to represent todos, a type of task
* Constructor for Todo that does not specify whether task is done
* Sets done to false by default
* Constructor for Todo that does specify whether task is done
* @param done whether task is done or not
* Returns a string representation of the todo task for displaying in ui
* @return string representing todo task for displaying in ui
* Resturns a string representation of the todo task for saving
* @return string representation of todo task for saving to storage
* Method to generate greet string when Duke is first run
* Method to generate string corresponding to Command.EXIT
System.out.println("\tBye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Method to generate string corresponding to Command.UNKNOWN
System.out.println("\tSorry, I do not know this command!");
* Method for listing tasks given a tasklist
* Loops through the task prepending it with a tab space and its index number
* before calling that task's toString method
* @param tasks TaskList object containing the tasks
* Method for listing through tasks in a given ArrayList, and printing them
* @param tasks ArrayList of Task objects to loop through
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasksn your list");
* Method for generate the string corresponging to Command.INDEXCOMMAND
* @param taskArray String[] of the user input split once by " "
public void indexCommand(int size, Task task, String[] taskArray) {
System.out.println("\tNice! I\'ve marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + size + " tasks in the list");
* Method for generating string corresponding to Command.ADDCOMMAND
public void addTask(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("\tGot it. I\'ve added this task:");
Todo todo = new Todo("walk my dog");
Todo todo = new Todo("walk my dog");
